values.description:
Move toolbar to its own element: `cs-toptoolbar`

This breaks the shrinking behaviour on scroll of mainToolbar

Blindly copied a bunch of CSS from `app-theme` to `cs-toptoolbar`

`gz-token` now has a permanent border when config is visible, and is completely invisible otherwise, as its innards are not meant to be used, but to be easily identified when visible

Login and logout from the menu on the top right
values.title: Port <cs-toptoolbar> from prototype branch

`gz-token` now has a permanent border when config is visible, and is completely invisible otherwise, as its innards are not meant to be used, but to be easily identified when visible

values.description:
* gz-home has been broken since the latest PR's, so I cleaned it up just to say "welcome"

* When you login, you automatically move to the dashboard

* If you refresh the page while logged in, your username still shows on the top

* If you logout and come back, you're not logged in
values.title: Stay logged in even after refreshing page

values.description:
A few different improvements:

* Launch button only shows for user `admin` (hardcoded for now, see [this](#!/osrf/cloudsim-portal/issues/2/add-a-route-to-get-whether-a-user-has) portal issue)

* Fixed distribution task (`gulp serve:dist`) and made it the task to be called on `npm start`

* Added a dummy page for a competition
values.title: Fix distribution task and use it

summary.raw:
A few different improvements:

* Launch button only shows for user `admin` (hardcoded for now, see [this](#!/osrf/cloudsim-portal/issues/2/add-a-route-to-get-whether-a-user-has) portal issue)

* Fixed distribution task (`gulp serve:dist`) and made it the task to be called on `npm start`

* Added a dummy page for a competition
summary.html:
A few different improvements:

  • Launch button only shows for user admin (hardcoded for now, see this portal issue)

  • Fixed distribution task (gulp serve:dist) and made it the task to be called on npm start

  • Added a dummy page for a competition

values.description:
* Connect to portal with socket to listen to status updates (for now, sending a new REST request and refreshing the whole list each time the socket says something changed)

* Rearranged list to use the statuses:
    1. Only show `gz-cmd` if machine is running
    1. Don't show kill button for terminated machines
    1. Started work on a colored status indicator, but it not quite working yet. If it bothers anyone to have the code commented out, I can move it to a branch.

* Removed refresh button

* Removed feedback text, as it is not making much sense with the whole page for now. I just commented it out, so we can reuse the messages in a different way later.

* Sort the machines by reverse launch date, newest machines show on top.

![statuscloud.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1691111732-statuscloud.png)
values.title: Update status

summary.raw:
* Connect to portal with socket to listen to status updates (for now, sending a new REST request and refreshing the whole list each time the socket says something changed)

* Rearranged list to use the statuses:
    1. Only show `gz-cmd` if machine is running
    1. Don't show kill button for terminated machines
    1. Started work on a colored status indicator, but it not quite working yet. If it bothers anyone to have the code commented out, I can move it to a branch.

* Removed refresh button

* Removed feedback text, as it is not making much sense with the whole page for now. I just commented it out, so we can reuse the messages in a different way later.

* Sort the machines by reverse launch date, newest machines show on top.

![statuscloud.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1691111732-statuscloud.png)
summary.html:
• Connect to portal with socket to listen to status updates (for now, sending a new REST request and refreshing the whole list each time the socket says something changed)

  • Rearranged list to use the statuses:

    1. Only show gz-cmd if machine is running
    2. Don't show kill button for terminated machines
    3. Started work on a colored status indicator, but it not quite working yet. If it bothers anyone to have the code commented out, I can move it to a branch.

  • Removed refresh button

  • Removed feedback text, as it is not making much sense with the whole page for now. I just commented it out, so we can reuse the messages in a different way later.

  • Sort the machines by reverse launch date, newest machines show on top.

values.description:
Addresses issue #10

The app now listens to `notification` events, with the fields `msg` (the message string to go on the toast) and `type` (the notification type, either `error` or `msg`).

I also created a new widget: `cs-serverstatus`, see issue #12.

values.title: Moved gz-token from cs-toptoolbar to cs-app

values.description:
* Add a `gz-grant` to `cs-app` which gets all permissions at startup (`this.$.grant.getall`) and forwards the results to its child elements. That is currently used to tell the dashboard whether the current user can see `cs-machinelauncher` or not.

* Commented out the `cs-sharebutton` which was in `cs-machineitem`, because that doesn't work yet.

* Added a `cs-sharebutton` to `cs-machinelauncher`, so users can grant other users the right to launch machines.

Trying it out:

1. Launch the server (`gulp serve`)

1. On Browsersync (http://localhost:3001/sync-options), disable all syncing

1. Open a normal tab and login as "admin". Admin sees the server status and machine launcher widgets:

    ![cs1.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1980796869-cs1.png)

1. Open a private tab and login as user "a". A sees an empty dashboard.

1. On the admin tab, clock on the share icon in the machine launcher and share it with a.

    ![cs2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3821943109-cs2.png)

1. Refresh a's tab, and now the machine launcher is there. 

    ![cs3.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3741316334-cs3.png)

1. You can try launching a machine with "a" and it should work. Admin won't see the machine.

1. Now on the admin tab, revoke a's permission to launch.

    ![cs4.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3713751435-cs4.png)

1. Refresh a's tab, and the launcher should be gone
values.title: Grant / revoke / get permissions for machine launcher

summary.raw:
* Add a `gz-grant` to `cs-app` which gets all permissions at startup (`this.$.grant.getall`) and forwards the results to its child elements. That is currently used to tell the dashboard whether the current user can see `cs-machinelauncher` or not.

* Commented out the `cs-sharebutton` which was in `cs-machineitem`, because that doesn't work yet.

* Added a `cs-sharebutton` to `cs-machinelauncher`, so users can grant other users the right to launch machines.

Trying it out:

1. Launch the server (`gulp serve`)

1. On Browsersync (http://localhost:3001/sync-options), disable all syncing

1. Open a normal tab and login as "admin". Admin sees the server status and machine launcher widgets:

    ![cs1.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1980796869-cs1.png)

1. Open a private tab and login as user "a". A sees an empty dashboard.

1. On the admin tab, clock on the share icon in the machine launcher and share it with a.

    ![cs2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3821943109-cs2.png)

1. Refresh a's tab, and now the machine launcher is there. 

    ![cs3.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3741316334-cs3.png)

1. You can try launching a machine with "a" and it should work. Admin won't see the machine.

1. Now on the admin tab, revoke a's permission to launch.

    ![cs4.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3713751435-cs4.png)

1. Refresh a's tab, and the launcher should be gone
summary.html:
• Add a gz-grant to cs-app which gets all permissions at startup (this.$.grant.getall) and forwards the results to its child elements. That is currently used to tell the dashboard whether the current user can see cs-machinelauncher or not.

  • Commented out the cs-sharebutton which was in cs-machineitem, because that doesn't work yet.

  • Added a cs-sharebutton to cs-machinelauncher, so users can grant other users the right to launch machines.

Trying it out:

  1. Launch the server (gulp serve)

  2. On Browsersync (http://localhost:3001/sync-options), disable all syncing

  3. Open a normal tab and login as "admin". Admin sees the server status and machine launcher widgets:

  4. Open a private tab and login as user "a". A sees an empty dashboard.

  5. On the admin tab, clock on the share icon in the machine launcher and share it with a.

  6. Refresh a's tab, and now the machine launcher is there.

  7. You can try launching a machine with "a" and it should work. Admin won't see the machine.

  8. Now on the admin tab, revoke a's permission to launch.

  9. Refresh a's tab, and the launcher should be gone

values.description:
Migration to Auth0:

* Needs [this](https://github.com/osrf/gz-grant/pull/5) gz-grant pull request so `resourcesupdated` works. The previous approach was conflicting with auth0. Why? No idea.

* Several hardcoded users are now set in the `.env` file and acquired with the `getConfig` middleware.

* Some new icons slipped into this PR.
values.title: Auth0

summary.raw:
Migration to Auth0:

* Needs [this](https://github.com/osrf/gz-grant/pull/5) gz-grant pull request so `resourcesupdated` works. The previous approach was conflicting with auth0. Why? No idea.

* Several hardcoded users are now set in the `.env` file and acquired with the `getConfig` middleware.

* Some new icons slipped into this PR.
summary.html:
Migration to Auth0:

  • Needs this gz-grant pull request so resourcesupdated works. The previous approach was conflicting with auth0. Why? No idea.

  • Several hardcoded users are now set in the .env file and acquired with the getConfig middleware.

  • Some new icons slipped into this PR.
